source_reference: Stopes, Marie Carmichael. Married Love: A New Contribution to the Solution of Sex Difficulties. 6th ed., A. C. Fifield, 1919.
content_summary: A pioneering and controversial early 20th-century book advocating for greater knowledge and openness regarding sexuality within marriage. Stopes discusses the importance of mutual sexual satisfaction, understanding female desire and rhythms, communication, and birth control for marital happiness.
public_domain_status: Published 1918, believed to be in the public domain in the US.
